leaders.bg: Ethan Senturia co-founded Dealstruck in 2012 and served as CEO until the company shut down in 2016. He graduated Summa Cum Laude from the Wharton School of Business and began his career as a credit research analyst at Lehman Brothers and Barclays Capital. Before Dealstruck, he was on the founding team of Ampush, a performance marketing company, where he served as VP of Online Media. At Dealstruck he raised over $150M in institutional debt and equity and led a 70-person team. After Dealstruck's collapse, he wrote the book 'Unwound: Real-time Reflections from a Stumbling Entrepreneur' about the experience.

desc: Dealstruck was an online peer-to-peer lending platform for small and medium-sized businesses, founded in 2012 and headquartered in Carlsbad, California (San Diego area). It was the first crowdlending platform to offer multiple loan products to SMBs and allow investors to choose specific investments. The company raised $19.5M in total funding over 5 rounds. Dealstruck stopped accepting new loan applications on November 15, 2016, after a failed acquisition deal with CAN Capital (a $33M offer that was turned down) led to financial instability. The company had struggled with profitability, often covering out-of-pocket costs and waiving fees, and suffered significant defaults including an $800K fraudulent loan. In December 2018, substantially all assets were acquired by iBusiness Funding, LLC. The Dealstruck brand was later sold to another company unconnected to the original founders. STATUS: DEFUNCT — ceased operations in 2016, assets acquired 2018.

news.h: How Dealstruck Arrived, 'Disrupted,' and Died — A Cautionary Online Lending Tale

news.h: Popular Business-Lending Marketplace Dealstruck Restructures

news.h: What Happened to Dealstruck & Why Did It Fail?
news.d: Analysis of Dealstruck's failure cited the rejected CAN Capital acquisition, profitability struggles, and the broader online lending bubble bursting in 2016 following the Lending Club scandal.

desc: deBanked is THE industry media publication and news platform for the merchant cash advance (MCA) and alternative lending space, operated by Raharney Capital, LLC from Brooklyn, New York. desc: Delancey Street is a business debt relief and settlement company headquartered in Midtown Manhattan, New York. The company specializes in helping business owners struggling with merchant cash advance (MCA) debt, unsecured business debt, and other forms of business financing obligations. Delancey Street's team includes attorneys, former prosecutors, and former lending industry insiders who have operated on both sides of the lending table, giving them insight into how funders think and negotiate. The firm offers MCA debt restructuring, business debt settlement, and legal defense services, with programs designed to help businesses become debt-free in 6-18 months. They also provide hard money lending services for real estate, including commercial bridge loans, fix-and-flip financing, and construction loans with rates of 8-12% and terms of 3-24 months. The company uses AI in its lending decision-making process and has expanded services to Los Angeles and other markets nationwide. Delancey Street was founded by entrepreneurs and legal professionals who recognized the need for business owners to have advocates against aggressive MCA collection practices.

desc: DigiFi is a cloud-based digital loan origination platform founded in 2017 by Joshua Jersey, Bradley Vanderstarren, and Matthew Norton, headquartered in Miami, FL (with a New York office at 25 Broadway). The platform automates the end-to-end loan origination process for consumer, mortgage, small business, and commercial lending. DigiFi-enabled lenders have processed more than $100 billion in loan applications. The company reached approximately $15M in annual revenue as of mid-2025 with about 50 employees across 4 continents. DigiFi's tech stack includes React, Node.js, and Lua, and the platform is SOC 2 Type II compliant. In 2025, DigiFi launched an AI Agent purpose-built to automate nuanced loan origination tasks such as conditions, stipulations, and verification activities. Key partnerships include Ascent (application optimization, Jan 2025), ValidiFI (automated credit decisioning, Dec 2024), Scienaptic AI (AI-powered credit decisions), and Carrington Labs (cash flow underwriting, Aug 2025). The founders previously built Promise Financial together and created DigiFi after being frustrated by legacy origination technology. THIS IS A HYPERVERGE COMPETITOR in the lending technology/underwriting automation space — DigiFi's AI agent and automated decisioning capabilities directly compete with HyperVerge's document analysis and underwriting products for the same lender customers.
